questions.question_text: Q:  What do electrical drawings include?

options.A: A:  Supply Voltage, Internal Wiring, Field Wiring, Location of controls

questions.question_text: Q:  To obtain a pressure reading in a U-tube water column the amount of water column displaced on the pressure side of the manomenter is added to what?

options.A: A:  Added to the amount displaced on the atmospheric side
options.B: A:  The air that is mixed with gas prior to ignition

questions.question_text: Q:  What is the space ratio for converting propane from liquid to gas?
Q:  What section in the code book is for Definitions?
Q:  Natural Gas / Propane in liquid states.  Does it occupy more or less space when converted to gas?
Q:  What section in the code is for Pressure Controls?
Q:  Charts, graphs and tables are used in this trade.  What are they?

options.A: A:  Circle graph, bar graph, line graph and trouble shooting chart
options.C: A:  Air that is mixed and added at the point of combustion and surrounds the flame

questions.question_text: Q:  What is the lower explosive limit (LEL) of natural gas?
Q:  What is the specific gravity of liquid propane and is it heavier or lighter than water?

options.A: A:  0.51    and is lighter than water
options.B: A:  Horizontal and virtical views at the same time

options.A: A:  Individual views of the front, rear, sides, top and bottom of an object.
options.C: A:  3 dimensional objects on a 2 dimensional piece of paper.
options.D: A:  Several sides at the same time.

questions.question_text: Q:  What is the most commonly used pictoral drawing?

options.B: A:  Flow Rate X Heat Value       cfh X 1000 natural gas and cfh X 2500 propane

questions.question_text: Q:  How many PPM does it take to start noticing symptoms of carbon monoxide?

options.A: A:  200 ppm in a couple hours
options.D: A:  Any air above the theoretical amount for perfect combustion

questions.question_text: Q:  Broken or dotted lines on a wiring diagram indicates?
Q:  Most natural gas burners produce CO in what range?
